CONJUGATES: authors (n. pl.) | authored (v. pt.) | authoring (v. prp.)
ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English autor, from Old French autor, from Latin auctor ('promoter, producer, originator'), from augēre ('to increase, originate, promote').

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The writer of a book, article, play, or other written work.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 书籍、文章、剧本或其他书面作品的撰写者或创作者。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She is the author of the best-selling novel published last year.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她是去年出版的那本畅销小说的作者。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The originator, creator, or primary agent of a plan, idea, theory, or action.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 某项计划、想法、理论或行动的发起者、创造者或主要执行者/主谋。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The committee is trying to identify the author of the controversial policy proposal.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 委员会正试图确定这项有争议的政策提案的提出者。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To write, create, or be the originator of a work, especially a technical document or piece of software.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 撰写、创作或成为某作品（尤指技术文档或软件）的作者。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He successfully authored the entire technical manual in under two months.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他在不到两个月的时间内成功地撰写了整本技术手册。
